HL7 Standard.summary: The DaVinci DEQM IG is fundamentally based on FHIR, using it as the core standard for data exchange and representation. It does not utilize CDA, v2, or v3, focusing solely on FHIR's RESTful approach. While it doesn't explicitly integrate across different HL7 paradigms, its reliance on FHIR and its interaction with other FHIR-based IGs like US Core and QI-Core demonstrates a commitment to the FHIR ecosystem.

Geographic Scope.summary: The Data Exchange for Quality Measures (DEQM) Implementation Guide explicitly states it is designed for the US Realm, addressing interoperability challenges specific to quality measurement and reporting in the United States. While acknowledging broader applicability, the primary focus and governance are within the US healthcare ecosystem.

Domain Focus.summary: The Data Exchange for Quality Measures (DEQM) Implementation Guide primarily focuses on standardizing the exchange of data for quality measurement and reporting, leveraging FHIR R4. It emphasizes the use of FHIR operations and specific profiles for different reporting scenarios, including individual and summary measure reports, as well as gaps in care reporting. While it touches upon administrative aspects and clinical data, its core purpose revolves around quality reporting and workflow optimization for data exchange between providers and payers.

Implementers.summary: The DaVinci DEQM IG focuses on standardizing the exchange of quality measure data between providers and payers, primarily for value-based care programs. EHR systems are central to implementing this IG, as they are the primary source of clinical data used for quality measurement. Payer systems are also key, as they receive and process the quality data for reimbursement and performance evaluation. Clinical Decision Support systems play an important role in identifying and addressing care gaps. Other systems have more limited or indirect involvement.

Users & Stakeholders.summary: The DaVinci DEQM IG primarily focuses on streamlining quality measure data exchange between healthcare providers and payers to support value-based care initiatives. Clinical Care Teams and Payers are the core users, driving the design and specifications. Healthcare Administrators and Government Agencies have significant influence due to their roles in quality reporting and oversight. Public Health Agencies and Research Organizations have specific needs related to population health and quality improvement research, respectively. Patients and Caregivers have minimal direct involvement in this IG.
